rule.name: EventRule1
rule.message: Event $value has more than one incoming arc. Use a connector to synchronize the flow of control before the event!
rule.description: Reports an event which has more than one incoming arc.

rule.name: EventRule2
rule.message: Event $value has more than one outgoing arc. Use a connector to split the flow of control after the event!
rule.description: Reports an event which has more than one outgoing arc.

rule.name: BusinessObjectRule1
rule.message: Business object $value has no outgoing control flow.
rule.description: Reports a business object which has no outgoing control flow.

rule.name: BusinessObjectRule2
rule.message: Business object $value has more than one outgoing arc. Use a connector to split the flow of control after the business object!
rule.description: Reports a business object which has more than one outgoing arc.

rule.name: BusinessObjectRule3
rule.message: Business object $value has no incoming control flow.
rule.description: Reports a business object which has no incoming control flow.

rule.name: BusinessObjectRule4
rule.message: Business object $value has more than one incoming arc. Use a connector to synchronize the flow of control before the business object!
rule.description: Reports a business object which has more than one incoming arc.

rule.name: BusinessObjectRule5
rule.message: Business object $value has no associated IT system.
rule.description: Reports a business object which has no associated IT system.

rule.name: BusinessObjectRule6
rule.message: Business object $value has no associated organizational unit.
rule.description: Reports a business object which has no associated organizational unit.

rule.name: BusinessObjectRule7
rule.message: Business object $value does not contain any attribute.
rule.description: Reports a business object which does not contain any attribute.

rule.name: BusinessObjectRule8
rule.message: Business object $value does not contain any method.
rule.description: Reports a business object which does not contain any method.

rule.name: OepcRule1
rule.message: The oEPC model must contain at least one business object.
rule.description: Reports an oEPC model that does not contain any business object.

rule.name: ElementRule1
rule.message: $value should be either join or split.
rule.description: Reports a connector being a join as well as a split.

rule.name: ElementRule2
rule.message: The connector does not have an incoming control flow.
rule.description: Reports a connector which does not have an incoming control flow.

rule.name: ElementRule3
rule.message: The connector does not have an outgoing control flow.
rule.description: Reports a connector which does not have an outgoing control flow.

rule.name: ElementRule4
rule.message: The connector has incoming information flow (which is not allowed).
rule.description: Reports a connector which has incoming information flow.

rule.name: ElementRule5
rule.message: The connector has outgoing information flow (which is not allowed).
rule.description: Reports a connector which has outgoing information flow.

rule.name: ElementRule6
rule.message: Element does not have a name.
rule.description: Reports an unnamed element.

rule.name: BusinessAttributeRule1
rule.message: Business attribute does not have a name.
rule.description: Reports an unnamed business attribute.

rule.name: BusinessMethodRule1
rule.message: Business method does not have a name.
rule.description: Reports an unnamed business method.

rule.name: SymbolRule1
rule.message: $value does not have a name
rule.description: Reports an unnamed element.

rule.name: ElementRule1
rule.message: The control flow can deadlock at the AND-join
rule.description: Reports a situation where the control flow can deadlock at the AND-join.

rule.name: ElementRule2
rule.message: The combination XOR-split -> AND-join is not allowed!
rule.description: Reports a combination XOR-split -> AND-join which can lead to a situation where the AND-join cannot be processed (deadlock)

rule.name: ElementRule3
rule.message: The combination OR-split -> AND-join is not allowed!
rule.description: Reports a combination OR-split -> AND-join which can lead to a situation where the AND-join cannot be processed (deadlock)

rule.name: ElementRule4
rule.message: Consider to replace the OR-join by an AND-join.
rule.description: Reports an OR-join that should be replaced by an AND-join which describes the intended behaviour more accurately..

rule.name: ElementRule5
rule.message: Consider to replace the OR-join by an XOR-join.
rule.description: Reports an OR-join that should be replaced by an XOR-join which describes the intended behaviour more accurately..

rule.name: ElementRule6
rule.message: The combination OR-split -> XOR-join is not allowed!
rule.description: Reports a combination OR-split -> XOR-join which can lead to a situation where more than one incoming flows reach the XOR join (lack of synchronization)

rule.name: ElementRule7
rule.message: The combination AND-split -> XOR-join is not allowed!
rule.description: Reports a combination AND-split -> XOR-join which can lead to a situation where more than one incoming flows reach the XOR join (lack of synchronization). If the notification level is WARNING only, this does not necessarily have to signalize an error.

rule.name: ElementRule1
rule.message: $value should be either a join or a split.
rule.description: Reports a connector being a join as well as a split.
